articles.headline: Environmental Group Behind the TXU Deal Hires a Banker
articles.snippet: Environmental Defense has hired Perella Weinberg Partners to advise it, possibly signaling that it wants an even more powerful seat at the bargaining table with TXU.
articles.abstract: Environmental Defense has hired Perella Weinberg Partners to advise it, possibly signaling that it wants an even more powerful seat at the bargaining table with TXU.
articles.lead_paragraph: The environmental movement is about to take a page from Wall Street’s deal-making playbook that may give “green mail” a good name.
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Felicity Barringer

articles.headline: Producer for Katie Couric Out at CBS News
articles.snippet: With the “CBS Evening News With Katie Couric” languishing in the ratings, CBS has reportedly dismissed the program’s producer.
articles.abstract: With the “CBS Evening News With Katie Couric” languishing in the ratings, CBS has reportedly dismissed the program’s producer.
articles.lead_paragraph: The shake-ups at the evening newscasts continued last night.

articles.headline: New York Label May Not Fit All in Giuliani Run
articles.snippet: The former mayor’s association with New York may be a hurdle to becoming the Republican presidential nominee.
articles.abstract: The former mayor’s association with New York may be a hurdle to becoming the Republican presidential nominee.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 7 — When Republicans say they are skeptical that Rudolph W. Giuliani, the former mayor of New York, can survive their party’s presidential nominating process, they usually point to his record of support for abortion rights, gay rights and gun control.

articles.headline: In Europe, Germany May Have to Take the Wheel in Going Green
articles.snippet: In getting European automakers to adhere to new limits on carbon dioxide emissions, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany will have to take on the industry at home.
articles.abstract: In getting European automakers to adhere to new limits on carbon dioxide emissions, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany will have to take on the industry at home.
articles.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, March 6 — Europe prides itself on its pioneering approach to climate change — a commitment that Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany aims to deepen in her term as president of the European Union.

articles.headline: Denial Reopens Wounds of Japan’s Ex-Sex Slaves
articles.snippet: Furor over the issue of war-era sex slaves has highlighted yet again Japan’s unresolved history in the region.
articles.abstract: Furor over the issue of war-era sex slaves has highlighted yet again Japan’s unresolved history in the region.
articles.lead_paragraph: SYDNEY, Australia, March 7 — Wu Hsiu-mei said she was 23 and working as a maid in a hotel in 1940 when her Taiwanese boss handed her over to Japanese officers. She and some 15 other women were sent to Guangdong Province in southern China to become sex slaves.

articles.headline: Shareholders of Take-Two Plot a Revolt
articles.snippet: A consortium of investors disclosed that it intended to oust the board and possibly the top management of Take-Two Interactive Software.
articles.abstract: A consortium of investors disclosed that it intended to oust the board and possibly the top management of Take-Two Interactive Software.
articles.lead_paragraph: A consortium of investors disclosed yesterday that it intended to oust the board and possibly the top management of Take-Two Interactive Software, a video-game publisher that has been plagued by legal, regulatory and accounting problems.

articles.headline: A New Box From Sony Turns Videotapes Into Shiny DVDs
articles.snippet: The DVDirect VRD-MC3 stresses two extremely important attributes: simplicity and reproduction quality.
articles.abstract: The DVDirect VRD-MC3 stresses two extremely important attributes: simplicity and reproduction quality.
articles.lead_paragraph: Citizens of ancient cultures made no multimedia records of their own birthday parties, weddings or babies’ first steps. How tragic and boring. When they sat down in front of the TV after dinner at family gatherings, what on earth did they watch?
